note: 1999–2001 she studied Romano-Germanic Philology at the Kuban State University in Krasnodar. From 2003 she studied English, German and Slavic Philology at the Cologne University. She graduated in
title: She completed her school education in Krasnodar in 1999. Prior to the final high school examination, she became scholarship from the international exchange program Youth for Understanding (YFU) and spent a high school year at the Cheyenne High School, Las Vegas

note: short “Village Sign”). 2009–2011 she was teaching introductory linguistic courses at the University of Cologne, including Morphology, Language across Modality, and Morphosyntax. At the same time, she was a Ph.D. candidate at the University of Cologne working on the documentation, annotation and linguistic description of Yolngu Sign Language.
title: and became DAAD award for outstanding achievements of foreign students at the German universities inter alia for the MA thesis on Classifiers in Spoken and Signed Languages. 2006–2009 she studied Sinology (Modern China Studies) at the Cologne University and graduated with a Master Degree in Sinology. 2007–2009 she worked as student and later as scientific assistant at Slavic and English departments of the University of Cologne. 2009–2012 she worked as a scientific researcher in the EuroBABEL project “Endangered Sign Languages in Village Communities
